Description: Bowl of Nile silt pottery with flat base and flaring sides, coated with red slip and burnished; interior decorated in white pigment with vegetal motif radiating from a circle around tondo and alternating with pendent chevrons; a white line is painted around the lip edge. Paint has faded extensively.
Curator's comments: Brunton says the decoration resembled White Cross-lined ware C42m in Petrie’ Corpus of Prehistoric pottery (1921), but the resemblance is not close.
Bibliographic references: Brunton 1937 / Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture (78)
